Description: Upper body sherd of South Ionian pottery little-master cup with turn to lip; interior: lip glazed; bowl reserved with two bands, one near lip the other on mid-wall; exterior: band at top of handle zone with row of added red dots; below in reserved zone, plastic knuckle-bone, glazed with red dots on top and on side; glazed below with row of red dots.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ140
Type series: Schlotzhauer Ionian Cup Type with application
Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the decorative pattern and the curved junction of the rim and body on the inside find parallels with his South Ionian little-master cups and South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B. For other South Ionian little master cups with knuckle-bones, see British Museum 1886,0401.1206. For parallels regarding the shape and decoration, see See Berlin 3678 from Rhodes (Samos 6.1, pl.42 no. 346).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.761) (Phase 3)
